CheckDisposed()

Returns Database handle. Throws if Database handle is already closed/disposed of.

Type Description
UInt32

Close()

Same as Dispose(). Close a database handle. Normally unnecessary. Use with care: This call is not mutex protected. Handles should only be closed by a single thread, and only if no other threads are going to reference the database handle or one of its cursors any further. Do not close a handle if an existing transaction has modified its database. Doing so can cause misbehavior from database corruption to errors like MDB_BAD_VALSIZE(since the DB name is gone). Closing a database handle is not necessary, but lets mdb_dbi_open() reuse the handle value. Usually it's better to set a bigger mdb_env_set_maxdbs(), unless that value would be large.

Declaration
public void Close()

Compare(Transaction, ReadOnlySpan<Byte>, ReadOnlySpan<Byte>)

Compare two data items according to a particular database. This returns a comparison as if the two data items were keys in the specified database.

Declaration
public int Compare(Transaction transaction, in ReadOnlySpan<byte> x, in ReadOnlySpan<byte> y)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Transaction transaction
ReadOnlySpan<Byte> x
ReadOnlySpan<Byte> y
Returns
Type Description
Int32

< 0 if x < y, 0 if x == y, > 0 if x > y

Delete(Transaction, ReadOnlySpan<Byte>)

Delete items from a database. This function removes key/data pairs from the database. If this instance is a MultiValueDatabase then all of the duplicate data items for the key will be deleted. This function will return MDB_NOTFOUND if the specified key/data pair is not in the database.

Declaration
public bool Delete(Transaction transaction, in ReadOnlySpan<byte> key)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Transaction transaction
ReadOnlySpan<Byte> key
Returns
Type Description
Boolean

Dispose()

Same as Close(). Close a database handle. Normally unnecessary, as databases dont have unmanaged resources that can be cleaned up independently of the environment. Database handles should only be disposed if one wants to reuse them so that the limit of database handles is not exceeded.

Declaration
public void Dispose()
Remarks

Use with care: This call is not mutex protected. Handles should only be closed by a single thread, and only if no other threads are going to reference the database handle or one of its cursors any further. Do not close a handle if an existing transaction has modified its database. Doing so can cause misbehavior from database corruption to errors like MDB_BAD_VALSIZE(since the DB name is gone). Closing a database handle is not necessary, but lets mdb_dbi_open() reuse the handle value. Usually it's better to set a bigger mdb_env_set_maxdbs(), unless that value would be large.

Get(Transaction, ReadOnlySpan<Byte>, out ReadOnlySpan<Byte>)

Get items from a database. This function retrieves key/data pairs from the database. The address and length of the data associated with the specified key are returned in the structure to which data refers. If the database supports duplicate keys (MDB_DUPSORT) then the first data item for the key will be returned. Retrieval of other items requires the use of mdb_cursor_get(). Note: The memory pointed to by the returned values is owned by the database. The caller need not dispose of the memory, and may not modify it in any way. For values returned in a read-only transaction any modification attempts will cause a SIGSEGV. Values returned from the database are valid only until a subsequent update operation, or the end of the transaction.

Declaration
public bool Get(Transaction transaction, in ReadOnlySpan<byte> key, out ReadOnlySpan<byte> data)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Transaction transaction

Transaction under which the Get operation is performed.
ReadOnlySpan<Byte> key

Key to specify which data item / record to retrieve.
ReadOnlySpan<Byte> data

Data / record to be returned.
Returns
Type Description
Boolean

true if data for key retrieved without error, false if key does not exist.

OpenCursor(Transaction)

Create a cursor. A cursor is associated with a specific transaction and database. A cursor cannot be used when its database handle is closed. Nor when its transaction has ended, except with mdb_cursor_renew(). It can be discarded with mdb_cursor_close(). A cursor in a write-transaction can be closed before its transaction ends, and will otherwise be closed when its transaction ends. A cursor in a read-only transaction must be closed explicitly, before or after its transaction ends. It can be reused with mdb_cursor_renew() before finally closing it. Note: Earlier documentation said that cursors in every transaction were closed when the transaction committed or aborted. Note: If one does not close database handles (leaving that to the environment), then one does not have to worry about closing a cursor before closing its database.

Declaration
public virtual Cursor OpenCursor(Transaction transaction)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Transaction transaction
Returns
Type Description
Cursor

Instance of Cursor.

Put(Transaction, ReadOnlySpan<Byte>, ReadOnlySpan<Byte>, PutOptions)

Store items into a database. This function stores key/data pairs in the database. The default behavior is to enter the new key/data pair, replacing any previously existing key.

Declaration
public bool Put(Transaction transaction, in ReadOnlySpan<byte> key, in ReadOnlySpan<byte> data, PutOptions options)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Transaction transaction

Transaction under which the Put operation is performed.
ReadOnlySpan<Byte> key

Key to identify the Data item to be stored.
ReadOnlySpan<Byte> data

Data / record to be stored.
PutOptions options

Options to specify how the Put operation should be performed.
Returns
Type Description
Boolean

true if inserted without error, false if NoOverwrite was specified and the key already exists.
